description: Redevelopment of the site by a new residential building comprising a total of 64 residential units including 28 for affordable housing, with basement car parking providing for 36 car parking spaces including 2 disabled car parking spaces, to be accomodated within a part 3, part 4 and part 5 storey building.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The following details shall be provided by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority before work on the relevant parts of the development is commenced.
a)  details of windows, glazing, balconies, stairs, doors, balustrading, brick facing materials, render and cedar cladding.
b) sample materials board to be erected on site and retained until the development is completed.
c) sample panel of brickwork used for the facing work to be constructed on site and retained until the development is completed.
The relevant parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of the building in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity and security in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15, EN20 and TR21 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - The details of the disabled access ramp shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. This part of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 and to ensure that visibility for vehicles existing the basement car-park is not compromised in accordance with TR19 the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until:
a)	The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; and
b)	The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy EN10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - Prior to the commencement of work on site, a scheme providing for the insulation of the proposed dwellings against the transmission of externally generated traffic noise and vibration from St Pancras Way shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed in accordance with the approved details before the dwellings are occupied.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the premises in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - Details of the proposed slab levels of the building hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the works commence and the development shall be completed in strict accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory scale of building in relation to its surroundings in accordance with policies EN19, EN31, EN47, EN52, RC1 and RC2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
 
Condition : 9 - No development shall take place until full details of lighting to the canal-side elevation and arcaded area have been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity and security in the scheme and the area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN20 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
